info.document:
It has been a roller coaster four years for Gundagai front rower Joel Field.

CHASING FOUR STRAIGHT: Gundagai front rower Joel Field is looking to make it four grand final victories in as many years on Saturday. Picture: Kieren L Tilly

View More Local BusinessList Your Business Here

It has been a roller coaster four years for Gundagai front rower Joel Field.

In 2014 he was part of a reserve grade premiership with the Tigers before being named the best as Gundagai ended their premiership drought a year later.

An Achilles heel injury forced him to reserves once more last season, when he again tasted success on the biggest day of the year.

Now he's looking for four straight titles, back up in the top grade.

Field is happy to be back.

"It is good to be back in first grade, but I just like playing for the Gundagai Tigers," Field said.

"It is a good community and it is good to be involved with the club with anything."

Field picked up a hamstring injury in the major semi-final but is ready to take on Southcity.
